author: Adrian Bordoy
comment: This app save me from having a disaster. Night before I had a extra large donner kebab with extra hot chilli sauce I had chilli sauce on chips and chilli sauce on the salad the next morning I was ok, I was pottering in the town centre the next minute I needed the toilet desperately I've got this app out and boom Saved me

author: Kai W
comment: I am hesitating to rate wether or not this app deserves a five star. It would be nice if we could rate the toilets. Who are reviewing the reports?

author: Patrick Hargarten
comment: This app sucks. All the pics of the locations are inaccurate. Most of the places listed are for customers only. Good idea for an app but very poorly executed.

author: Inigo Macasaet
comment: Useless! It shows random houses as available public restrooms. What a joke!

author: Ben Alderfer
comment: Why did you make it all white? You used to have good designs

author: Shrey Sanghavi
comment: Really useful application. Especially in New York City

author: Dominique Rollino
comment: It needs open hours for me to actually depend on this. Preferably a review portion too, so we could know how nice or not it was

author: Gauthier Roebroeck
comment: Would be nice to be able to long press the map to add new data at the location pressed.

author: Stanley Chung
comment: A life saver.

author: Mandeep S
comment: Really good app. Could you also add an option to add a combination number as many toilets require a combination number to be entered before you can get access to the toilets ;)

author: mamat hensem
comment: User should be able to write review on every toilet

author: Doug McNulty
comment: Want to tell my friends. Have share link easier to find.

author: Michael Murphy
comment: Vital app. Especially useful for the elderly and infirm.  Thank you Sam for your ongoing development!

author: Harrison Mantas
comment: I'm a full-time Rideshare driver and this app will be really useful for those times when you have to go

reply.author: Sam Ruston
reply.content: We're currently doing some server maintenance. The "near me" section will work again soon.

author: Ryan
comment: Thanks Sam!

author: Peter Banks
comment: Much prefer previous map style

author: Ron Bemis
comment: I guess for some people, having all the data available on your phone is a good thing. But for most of us, it's a big waste of space on our device, because we have internet access! When is my local data updated,like? Also, this can't be considered crowd sourced if there's no way to modify or delete an entry - like if a place was permanently closed. Much of the data is way out of date.

reply.author: Sam Ruston
reply.content: Just released a new version that let's you report toilets as closed

author: Dennis S.
comment: It really works off line!  I used this in New Zealand and my phone doesn't work there but this app worked great off line. What you had to do was start the day off with your phone on wifi. Open the app and make sure your GPS locator is on. Using the app map go over your day's route so it will be in then phone's history. You're good as gold. When you open the app far from home, the locator finds you on the map and gives you the information it has stored. It's magic.  For app use where I live, I find it better than the other apps. While the other apps I have used rely heavily on familiar 'fast food' outlets as the sole location in an area, this app found lots of the free public ones, like parks and shopping centers.  I also found it was real easy to add locations into the data base. So hopefully users can improve the knowledge base. Having used in extensively in New Zealand and around my home in the US, I was pleased with how many locations were in the data base. It even knew of bathrooms that were off the beaten track in rural NZ, even backcountry hiking areas. No app can know all the free and easy bathroom locations, but for me this did a better than fine job.

author: Suzie Corbett
comment: I just installed and looked close to my house before using on vacation.  It missed 99% of public restrooms ands of the few it showed..totally wrong. It showed a Walmart miles from where it actually is.  I don't know where it would take you but I'm not trusting in unfamiliar places.  Be safe!

author: Dan K
comment: Fairly good but many restrooms near me are not listed. Then I submitted two locations about 4 days ago and they did not show up in the app.

reply.author: Sam Ruston
reply.content: Sorry about that, they have to be manually reviewed before appearing in the app. As of now, all submitted requests have been approved or rejected, so they should appear in the app now.

author: Tammera Espinal
comment: It doesn't distinguish between the ones that are open right now and the ones that are closed.  Also there are a lot that are missing,  such as the 24 hour Kroger on Wirt and Westview in Houston.
title: Good except

author: Cynthia Van Ness
comment: Would give it 5 stars if I could  correct my own additions or other people's. Other than that, it provides a good public service.
title: Just needs a few more features

author: Geocaching Plonker
comment: Need to add opening times option as some public toilets get locked at night, also a cleanness rating would be great too
title: Helpful but could be better

author: Heather M
comment: Cleanliness/convenience ratings would be great! Also missing LOTS of locations - been a few days and submissions are still not showing, so not sure how long it takes for those to go through? Titles could be better. Overall though, it'll get the job done if you really need it! Downloaded for travel purposes :)
title: Ok, but can be better

author: Mark Gibbons
comment: Took me to a bathroom in literally 20 seconds, unusual an app actually does what it says!
title: It works to well

author: Geoff Shannon
comment: It has worked fairly well, sometimes let down by the GPS.
Installed the app while sitting in McDonald's and apparently the nearest toilet is 3km away!
title: Will it work accurately

author: Rohit Gupta
comment: It wants me to turn off screen overlay. Why.

reply.author: Sam Ruston
reply.content: Unfortunately not my fault. Android doesn't let you accept permissions if you have a screen overlay. Once you've accepted the permissions though you're free to have all the screen overlays you want. This is a security measure in Android, not my app.

comment: Most toilets are fake locations

comment: No toilets in my area.

comment: This isn't one you need often, but when you need it you really need it.

comment: The app does not lock on my gps location and its showing me in a different country then I am, secondly there is no button or option to locate me manually.

reply.content: Use the search to locate you, if the GPS is giving an incorrect location.
